Oh, quick thing to remember, if you at all can, use the whole device, not a partition for your md device.
That way you dont' have to worry about alignment issues.  I had a day to play with an external 4-bay sata array before I had to put data on it a week or two ago.
Putting the MD device on partitions was a huge performance hit.
oh.. so instead of doing a LINUXRAID partition spaning the full size you just target the /dev/sda rather than /dev/sda1?
Yes.
I mean, if you manually align the partition, then it's moot, but if you didn't, or don't want to bother, use /dev/sda rather than /dev/sda1
